sections.heading: Clinical Laboratory Work; Billing Patient or Third Party in Excess of Amount Billed Licensed Person
sections.text:
A person licensed to practice medicine by an agency of the department of licensing and regulation, a hospital, agency or any other entity billing patients or third parties for laboratory work, shall not bill a patient for laboratory work performed by a clinical laboratory for any amount in excess of the amount billed by the clinical laboratory to the licensed person for such services.

History:1972, Act 358, Imd. Eff. Jan. 9, 1973

sections.heading: Physicians Not to Receive Fee From Laboratory.
sections.text:
A person licensed to practice medicine by an agency of the department of licensing and regulation shall not receive a fee or other remuneration from a clinical laboratory or an intermediary for a clinical laboratory for submitting specimens from patients to a clinical laboratory.

History:1972, Act 358, Imd. Eff. Jan. 9, 1973

sections.heading: Violation; Penalty.
sections.text:
A person who is in violation of section 1 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment for not more than 1 year or a fine of not more than $500.00 or both.

History:1972, Act 358, Imd. Eff. Jan. 9, 1973
